Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the nature of the activity described in the consent form?
A) The activity is a routine medical treatment not involving research.
B) The activity is a commercial survey to improve marketing strategies.
C) The activity is a research study involving the collection of health information.
D) The activity is a recreational program for new parents.

Correct answer: C) The activity is a research study involving the collection of health information.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary objective of the BMT CTN 1902 research study for which the pregnancy partner is providing consent?
A) To evaluate the safety of prenatal vitamins in pregnant partners of multiple myeloma patients; B) To assess the effectiveness of a new dietary program for pregnant partners; C) To determine the safety and efficacy of CAR T-cell therapy and maintenance therapy with lenalidomide in multiple myeloma patients; D) To study the impact of regular exercise on pregnancy outcomes in partners of cancer patients.

Correct answer: C) To determine the safety and efficacy of CAR T-cell therapy and maintenance therapy with lenalidomide in multiple myeloma patients.

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
For how long will the study collect information from the participant's infant?
A) Until the infant is 6 months old
B) Until the infant is 1 year old
C) Until the infant is 2 years old
D) Until the infant is 18 years old

Correct answer: B) Until the infant is 1 year old

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding any additional costs to the subject for participating in the research study described in the consent form?
A) Participants will receive a stipend to cover pregnancy-related costs.
B) The research study will cover all costs related to the pregnancy, delivery, and newborn care.
C) Participants will not incur any additional costs because all treatments are provided free of charge.
D) Participants will not receive any payment for providing information, and the research will not cover any costs related to pregnancy, delivery, newborn care, abortion, or miscarriage.

Correct answer: D) Participants will not receive any payment for providing information, and the research will not cover any costs related to pregnancy, delivery, newborn care, abortion, or miscarriage.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What will the study team collect information about from the participant if she agrees to provide her pregnancy and newborn information?
A) The participant's favorite foods and exercise habits.
B) The participant's age, sex, race/ethnicity, health, medications during pregnancy, previous pregnancies, current pregnancy, delivery, and baby's health.
C) The participant's financial records and employment history.
D) The biological father's complete medical history and genetic information.

Correct answer: B) The participant's age, sex, race/ethnicity, health, medications during pregnancy, previous pregnancies, current pregnancy, delivery, and baby's health.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to stop providing pregnancy or newborn information for the study?
A) Your medical care will be discontinued; B) The information already collected may still be used in the study; C) You will be required to pay a penalty; D) You will be obligated to continue participating in other unrelated studies

Correct answer: B

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
Questions:
Which of the following procedures is considered experimental in the context of the BMT CTN 1902 study?
A) Standard chemotherapy for multiple myeloma
B) Autologous Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation without any additional therapy
C) Anti-B Cell Maturation Antigen Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cell Therapy for Multiple Myeloma
D) Routine blood pressure and health monitoring during pregnancy

Correct answer: C

Topics: The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to be involved in the BMT CTN 1902 study for the collection of pregnancy and newborn information?
A) 50; B) 100; C) 150; D) The consent form does not specify the number of participants.

Correct answer: D

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
What is a potential risk associated with participating in the BMT CTN 1902 study as a pregnancy partner?
A) Exposure to experimental drugs; B) Loss of confidentiality; C) Financial costs for providing information; D) Health risks to the newborn from direct treatment

Correct answer: B) Loss of confidentiality

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
What are the potential benefits of participating in the BMT CTN 1902 study for the pregnant partner providing information about her pregnancy and newborn?

A) The pregnant partner will receive a new experimental drug as part of the study.
B) The pregnant partner will receive financial compensation for participating in the study.
C) The information may help in the care of future pregnancies where one parent has received CAR T-cell therapy or lenalidomide.
D) The pregnant partner will receive medical treatment for her and her newborn's health conditions as part of the study.

Correct answer: C) The information may help in the care of future pregnancies where one parent has received CAR T-cell therapy or lenalidomide.

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes how your confidentiality will be handled in the study according to the consent form?
A) Your personal information will be shared publicly to promote the study.
B) Your personal information will be kept confidential, but may be shared with certain agencies or groups as required by law.
C) Your personal information will be used for marketing purposes by the study sponsors.
D) Your personal information will be completely anonymous and no agencies or groups will have access to it.

Correct answer: B) Your personal information will be kept confidential, but may be shared with certain agencies or groups as required by law.

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
What does the new consent form state about compensation for participants in the event of injury related to the study?

A) Participants will receive financial compensation for any injuries sustained during the study.
B) Participants will receive free medical treatment for any injuries sustained during the study.
C) Participants will not receive any compensation or medical treatments for injuries related to the study.
D) The consent form does not specify information about compensation or medical treatments for injuries.

Correct answer: C) Participants will not receive any compensation or medical treatments for injuries related to the study.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you have questions about your rights as a research participant or wish to report a complaint or concern, whom should you contact?
A) The local Principal Investigator; B) The National Marrow Donor Program (NMDP) Institutional Review Board (IRB) Administrator; C) The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA); D) Your personal physician

Correct answer: B) The National Marrow Donor Program (NMDP) Institutional Review Board (IRB) Administrator

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form state about your right to discontinue participation in the study?

A) If you choose to discontinue participation, you will lose access to certain medical benefits.
B) You may discontinue participation at any time, but you will incur a penalty.
C) You can stop providing information at any time without affecting your current or future medical care.
D) Discontinuing participation will result in a mandatory review of your medical records by the study team.

Correct answer: C) You can stop providing information at any time without affecting your current or future medical care.
